R. Bruijn, F. S. Gaastra, Ivo Sch√∂ffer, Dutch-Asiatic Shipping in the 17th and 18th Centuries, Martinus Nijhoff Publishers, Alphen aan den Rijn, Netherlands, 1987, Volume I, p. 52.
content.question: Which of the following accurately describes the overall change in the size of ships being built over the two centuries?

choices.label: The Dutch East India Company produced the same proportion of ships in each category in both centuries.
The Dutch East India Company produced a higher proportion of ships in the larger two categories in the eighteenth century.
The Dutch East India Company produced a higher proportion of ships in the smaller two categories in the eighteenth century.
The Dutch East India Company produced a lower proportion of ships in the larger two categories in the eighteenth century.

content.answer: The Dutch East India Company produced a higher proportion of ships in the larger two categories in the eighteenth century.

topic.text: 3.3: Continuities and Changes to Economic Practice and Development

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
